content.description: "Start on Big Edge. Go right then climb up." I'm not exactly how right, you have to go, or if there are any specific hold you have to reach. "Brush My Reach" is just to the left of this, and might share some holds? I'm not sure there isn't a lot of information on this climb.
content.location:
Egg Boulder, same start as Brush My Reach. On the South side, in scoop. 20th Street should be to your right, and a large boulder should be to your left.

 You basically need to climb down the V2 that is just to the left to get off the boulder safely.

content.description: "Corner start edges, climb up left to the top." # 24 on the 20th Street Boulder Marty Karabine Guide. Sorry this is all I have at the moment.
content.location: The Egg Boulder on 20th Street. North East Corner.

content.description: Stand Start, climb straight up. # 25 On the Marty Carbine Pocket Guide.
content.location: 20th Street, Egg Boulder, East Side Center

content.description: SD, climb straight up. # 25 On the Marty Carbine Pocket Guide.
content.location: 20th Street, Egg Boulder, Center East side.

content.description: From rock, climb left and up arete to the top. #23 on the Marty Karabine Pocket Guide.
From the rock, big hold then go up. #22 on the 20th Street Boulders Marty Karabine guide.
content.location: North West Corner of the Egg Boulder.

content.description:
From the big lower edge get some feet and throw the edge about 5 feet up. Continue climbing straight up. 

 Effort wise this felt considerably easier than a V6. Maybe it's because I'm tall. 

 The down climb can be tricky. The easiest method for me was to down climb just to left of the climb itself.Â
content.protection: A single pad will do you well. Just watch out for the large rock to the left of the start.
content.location: On the The Egg boulder next to 20th street. On the South East facing "arete". There is a "scoop" with a large single pad edge with some small crystals for feet. #27 in the Marty Karabin Guide.

content.description: The Egg is a nice granite boulder that is literally 5 feet from the road and has ample parking. It features problems up to V8 with a few remaining projects of varying quality, including a direct version to Static of Faith. Most landing are flat and protectable with a few pads, with some exceptions.
